title: Treasury Wine Estates boss Michael Clarke to retire
text:
The man credited with leading Treasury Wine Estates (TWE) from takeover target to market darling, chief executive Michael Clarke, will retire in the September quarter of 2020 after more than six years at the company.

Treasury announced on Monday that the chief operating officer, Tim Ford, will succeed Mr Clarke next year.

Tim Ford will become TWE's new chief executive in September 2020. Grainnie Quinlan

Mr Clarke. who intends to return to Britain upon his retirement to spend more time with family, will act as an adviser to Treasury for an extra year, to provide strategic support across key initiatives including potential merger and acquisition opportunities.

He joined Treasury as chief executive in March 2014, arriving after a stint as the chief executive of listed British group Premier Foods. A long career in the food and beverages sector had included stints at Kraft Foods and the Coca-Cola Company.

At the time Treasury was in trouble, with its shares languishing at $3.70. The stock closed at $18.60.
description: Treasury's chief operating officer, Tim Ford, will succeed Michael Clarke in the September quarter of 2020.
